channel.title: UBuntU
channel.description:
Ok, so i really need to format my computer, but i do not have a Windows Startup disk, i could buy one but im lazy =p. So i've heard something about ubuntu, its like windows i think? I've seen it on friends computer but im not srue if its worth it. Soo my question is what is ubuntu like? Is it worth getting? Does it run good with rsps, real rs etc etc. I've got windows 2005? I think or 06, might get windows 7 sometime, not sure. So if anyone could give me some pro's/cons about ubuntu on weather i should download that or not.
Thanks

item.title: UBuntU
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Didn’t even think of that =P, forgot i even had that shit

Read full topic

item.title: UBuntU
item.dc:creator: @Motokid126 Motokid126
item.description:
@Motokid126 wrote:

Ahh ok thanks for the help. I’ll just stick to what i have now and buy a new startup disk and format my computer, the disk i have atm is corrupt

Read full topic

item.title: UBuntU
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Motokid126:

not sure how =p. I’ll need to do some reading up on it. I’m so used to windows xp, never ran on anything else. Is it Better then windows? In your opinion. Do you know if it has many problems or not

My opinion is, don’t use it. You’ll find it too frustrating because you don’t see what i am saying.

It’s a good OS, user friendly. It’s pretty bug free too.

Read full topic

item.title: UBuntU
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Ubuntu is Linux

It is no way shape OR form like windows, let alone windows xp.

As for RSPS, if you know how to run .sh files then you’ll have no problem with private servers on Ubuntu.

Read full topic
